poem:
Title: "In the Shroud of Civic Shadows"

Those walls pulse with pained whispers,
wounded, rusted, yet standing tall.
Tenacious testament of time - 
a frail bulwark in dire need.
Bricks older than the blood they guard, 
plead for mortar made from gold.
Bid ministers acknowledge age,
hear the ancient structures sing.
Crumbling heroes, brave as warriors, 
without a scalpel, yet still to save.
